verses.text: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,
Hear my words, O ye wise \add men;\add* And give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
For the ear trieth words, As the mouth tasteth meat.
Let us choose to us judgment: Let us know among ourselves what \add is\add* good.
For Job hath said, I am righteous: And God hath taken away my judgment.
Should I lie against my right? My wound \add is\add* incurable without transgression.
What man \add is\add* like Job, \add Who\add* drinketh up scorning like water?
Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, And walketh with wicked men.
For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing That he should delight himself with God.
Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: Far be it from God, \add that he should do\add* wickedness; And \add from\add* the Almighty, \add that he should commit\add* iniquity.
For the work of a man shall he render unto him, And cause every man to find according to \add his\add* ways.
Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, Neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
Who hath given him a charge over the earth? Or who hath disposed the whole world?
If he set his heart upon \add man\add*, \add If\add* he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;
All flesh shall perish together, And man shall turn again unto dust.
If now \add thou hast\add* understanding, hear this: Hearken to the voice of my words.
Shall even he that hateth right govern? And wilt thou condemn him that is most just?
\add Is it fit\add* to say to a king, \add Thou art\add* wicked? \add And\add* to princes, \add Ye are\add* ungodly?
\add How much less to him\add* that accepteth not the persons of princes, Nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? For they all \add are\add* the work of his hands.
\add In\add* a moment shall they die, And the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: And the mighty shall be taken away without hand.
For his eyes \add are\add* upon the ways of man, And he seeth all his goings.
\add There is\add* no darkness, nor shadow of death, Where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
For he will not lay upon man more \add than right;\add* That \add he\add* should enter into judgment with God.
He shall break in pieces mighty \add men\add* without number, And set others in their stead.
Therefore he knoweth their works, And he overturneth \add them\add* in the night, so that they are destroyed.
He striketh them as wicked \add men\add* In the open sight of others;
Because they turned back from him, And would not consider any of his ways:
So that \add they\add* cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, And he heareth the cry of the afflicted.
When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? And when he hideth \add his\add* face, who then can behold him? Whether \add it be done\add* against a nation, Or against a man only:
That the hypocrite reign not, Lest the people be ensnared.
Surely it is \add meet to be\add* said unto God, I have borne \add chastisement\add*, I will not offend \add any more:\add*
\add That which\add* I see not teach thou me: If I have done iniquity, I will do no more.
\add Should it be\add* according to thy mind? he will recompense it, Whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: Therefore speak what thou knowest.
Let men of understanding tell me, And let a wise man hearken unto me.
Job hath spoken without knowledge, And his words \add were\add* without wisdom.
My desire \add is that\add* Job may be tried unto the end Because of \add his\add* answers for wicked men.
For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, He clappeth \add his hands\add* amongst us, And multiplieth his words against God.
